RLGeo9GmUEtKZ8362VBMYQ.text: Honestly this is the best restaurant in Pittsburgh. I truly have not tried a better Thai restaurant in the States in my entire life and I've been going here for years. I always get the massaman curry and the Tom Tom soup...  and yesterday I tried the fried rice and pork buns for the first time. It was the best pork bun I've ever had in my entire life. I love you guys

LVq5aANMPocBkvFCJAG-Yg.text: I never want this place to close. It is a spot that makes my mouth water and my belly rumble. I love to find reasons to go, like I need a better reason than, dang this is good food. I love that the decor has really transformed since the remodel years ago but the food has stayed the same. I honestly love it. It is hard to just pick one thing on the menu that I love because, honestly it is all so freaking good. This trip we came because I had a friend visiting from California and was craving Thai food. Of course this was the spot that we recommended. IT is so close to my house that I come more often than I should.   Starters:  Thai Spring Rolls (fried): Fried spring rolls stuffed with vegetables, glass noodles. Served with plum sauce. I mean their fried springs rolls are fantastic. I think that they were 2 in the order so if you are looking to feed a group it would be a good idea to pick more from the menu. Filling but I could eat the order of two myself, and I am not that big of a sharer.   Thai Cuisine Rolls (fresh): Fresh rice paper stuffed with lettuce, basil leaves, and vermicelli noodles. Served with Thai Cuisine special house sauce. These were also good. We added tofu to the rolls. They also come with only two rolls but are a bit bulkier so they are more sustainable for an appetizer.  We asked for these rolls to be cut in half to help us divide them up more evenly with the group. This worked out nicely for all of us.   Fried tofu (personal favorite/fried): Crispy fried tofu. Served with a peanut sauce. Personal favorite. I love fried tofu and Thai Cuisine does a really good job. Not to crispy and not too much breading. Just the right amount of fried to make you want to come back for more but not worry about the calories.   Main Dish:  Panang Curry: Broccoli, bell peppers, and basil leaves in a coconut curry sauce. Heck yes. This is what I get all the time. I add extra veggies and chicken to mine to make it a more filling dish. I love the sauce and could drink it if that wasn't super weird or possibly give me a bad belly ache. The veggies are always crisp and tasty. I like that you also get a choice for brown or white rice. I usually like brown but sometimes will mix it up if I am feeling peckish. I would suggest a nice even spice level of 3. I do not like to not be able to enjoy what I am eating so a level 3 is just up my alley.  I love it here. I think that more people should try it out. They are also BYOB so we enjoyed a nice bottle of wine for a glass fee that was really reasonable. They even brought us out a nice bucket of ice to chill the wine in.   The service and the staff were excellent. The food is top notch. Come here for a nice dinner and great conversation. It really is something else.

3EkeXO0ZUDWBydSWNyMBBw.text: The best thing I've had at Thai Cuisine is their crab rangoons. Honestly the food is just mediocre - it's not great, it's not awful, but you're safest going with a noodle dish or curry rather than something more complicated. Doesn't get terribly spicy and I've definitely found better Thai places in Pittsburgh - but I'll order a pad Thai for delivery from here because the price isn't bad and it's still fine.

9GdOwR1Q6mPHY5ndk2IIIw.text: I came here a year or two ago and can't forget about it ever since. Finally I made my way back here and grabbed take out. It was just delicious as I remembered! The place isn't classic and quite cozy. Drunken noodle is my all time favorite!!

dCTbqoKY4Az_puZ_KGHuiQ.text: For a time in Pittsburgh, I lived within walking distance of Thai Cuisine and frequented this spot on the regular. It was never usually crowded upon my visits, but after walking by multiple times after moving from Bloomfield, it looked like they had a steady stream of customers each time when I passed. One of my favorite things about many restaurants in Pittsburgh is the BYOB-so economical and allows you to bring a wine that you already know you will enjoy in addition to having paid about 1/3 or more less than what one would pay at a restaurant.   The decor is modest but service has always been warm and efficient. I definitely enjoyed the booths which I find less and less at ethnic restaurants. What you are really here, though, is for the food. I've tried a variety of options here over time: the thai spring rolls (crunchy, sufficient veggie filling), the mixed vegetables with chicken, the spicy basil with chicken (spicy but not overwhelming for my palate), the pad thai with chicken (saucy, noddles cooked perfectly, generous portion of chicken), and the spicy basil noodles with chicken (at a 7 this was perfect for me and provided some heat without overdoing it-very flavorful).   I'd definitely recommend dining at Thai Cuisine for a delicious Thai meal! Parking on the street can be difficult; I recommend the pay parking lot around the corner from the restaurant!

6YfUlwcDU8O-Zwjwu4aPcA.text: This restaurant. Yaaaaaaaaas. As I've mentioned in previous reviews, I'm not really big on Asian cuisine. Lots of my friends always rave about it (Thai Cuisine specifically), so I figured I'd give in and try it. Being one of my first Thai restaurants that I tried a few years ago, I instantly became hooked and it's one of my favorite places to hit up for Thai!   The atmosphere and warm and the owners are always very pleasant. It's also BYOB which is an automatic win!  Their menu is huge. I typically always get something chicken related. Never once have I had a bad meal. The portions are always decent as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Cuisine - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

sHuCCGjjHjzj3QgIcCj4qA.text: Very tasty! One of the best Thai restaurants in Pittsburgh.  They offer an entire vegetarian menu and most dishes can be made vegan, they even have mock-meat options! Staff was very accommodating of our dietary restrictions!

xgCOZ9VX43PgfOBMah-MgA.text: First dining at Thai Cuisine was very enjoyable! We ordered the three sauce (?) chicken and spicy basil chicken fried rice - excellent flavors and great portions. Can't wait to try again!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Cuisine - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pad Thai with tofu, spice level 10!
Photo of Thai Cuisine - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lunch spicy basil chicken fried rice with peanut sauce salad
Photo of Thai Cuisine - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Complimentary crisps with sweet sauce

I2YwUJ2P4m0boDQnfIKNOQ.text: Fresh ingredients, great curries. Loved the chicken skewers. Reliable delivery time. My new favorite Thai.

Q75gRT2UhphGk9y_tq-wEA.text: I feel like I start so many reviews by saying "this if my fave spot in Pittsburgh", but I swear on our 6 Super Bowl championships that Thai Cuisine is my absolute favorite place in this city! So much so that I have to limit myself to a weekly trip, cause if I had unlimited money, I'd eat here every day.  Their vegan/veg options are plentiful, and the staff are super-knowledgeable about all the ingredients in their food and how items are prepared. You can rest-assured if you have any sort of dietary restriction or allergy, Thai Cuisine will happily accommodate you. They are also BYOB will a nominal fee. I recommend popping across the street to Caliente to pick-up beer if you forget to plan ahead!  My go-to dish is the Three Flavored Tofu with brown rice. Tofu is not an easy thing to cook, and there is nothing worse than mushy tofu. I can promise that the tofu from Thai Cuisine is fried to a crispy, golden perfection. Even your most carnivorous friends would find this dish delightful.  Never change, Thai Cuisine.

gOJTiWuw0ZfYSLhmQWnauQ.text: Love this place! The food is delicious and always exceeds my expectations. I love their Spicy Noodle with chicken and the crab rangoon!

IqlgnOCuq13JKaPPPIK1Wg.text: Thai Cuisine is just ok, there's nothing that makes them stand out from other thai restaurants. Around the city of Pittsburgh there's a lot of Thai restaurants so you really have to make yourself stand out over the other restaurants and Thai Cuisine just doesn't have that quality. I started with spring rolls and veggie Tom Kha soup. The soup was very good. The spring rolls were good and the dipping sauce was ok, nothing special.  For my entree I ordered the veggie bird nest noodles (crispy noodles). I didn't think it was that good. There was WAY too much sauce, it was almost a soup and the sauce didn't have much flavor at all. Also the veggies were sliced too big, they should have been cut into smaller pieces, it would have made the dish more manageable to eat. I'll eat at Thai Cuisine again if it's suggested by someone else but it won't be my first choice for a thai restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Cuisine - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Veggie crispy noodles
Photo of Thai Cuisine - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Veggie spring rolls and tom Kha soup

wTidOl4_q-H2KsKFNXTEBg.text: I absolutely love Thai Cuisine. I initially found this spot while searching Yelp for new vegan spots close to Shadyside.  I called to be absolutely sure they can veganize menu items and to my excitement, they could! They were incredibly nice and understood my concerns, a lot of Thai restaurants have fish sauce hidden in every dish, but this place does not!   It's easy to order there and online (via grub hub), all you have to do is make a note that the dish needs to be vegan and it even prints off on the receipt, so when they drop off your order you get some additional piece of mind.  The cashew entree with tofu/veggies and the green salad are a must. The tofu is fried but not crispy amid all the veggies & comes with rice to soak up the mild chili sauce. The salad is fairly simple with greens, cucumber, onion etc. but the dressing or sauce as I would say, is stellar. It's a peanut/coconut milk sauce and I can honestly say I would gladly eat this every day for the rest of my life.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Cuisine - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vegan cashew take-out for a rainy day win. Also, that green salad tho

VUFEGGc84EuwVnoWWcaXZw.text: I had to order a dinner for about 15 physicians to be delivered between 5-515p.  While Thai Cuisine is closed between 2:30-5, their service was impeccable.    I called Thai Cuisine around 11:30 am to figure out if/how they could do our order.  I wanted to see if they could even have our food at 5.  The gentleman I spoke with was awesome.  Let me know that while they didn't deliver, grub hub did.  He also let me know  - they could take our order over the phone so they could start - or I could submit it on grubhub with the 5p delivery request.  I asked which was easier for them as I truly did appreciate all their help.  THe order was placed via grubhub. ( I will tell you the grubhub part of the experience was terrible (delivery driver in the lobby of the hospital saying rude things about other races, phone didn't work and said our delivery was delivered 10 minutes before we received it).  But this isn't a review on grubhub!)  Thai Cuisine beautifully labeled very container so I knew who got what food.  They sent forks, plates, extra sauce and chopsticks.  Everything was perfect. I couldn't have asked for an easier order.    Every.single.physician raved about their food.  Every drop was eaten.  It was delicious!  Not a single complaint.  I don't have any eating in the restaurant experience, but to go orders are amazing and will certainly happen again!  Thank you Thai Cuisine for being so helpful and accomodating!

z6nHAQnSyIz3XMRmY4j0uA.text: Truly my favorite Thai restaurant in all of Pittsburgh. They are attentive if you eat in and always quick with take out. The food it self is DELICIOUS. You know how sometimes thai places get it wrong with the heat rating? Thai cuisine is always on point and is a very level setting. 7 every time because I like heat but not burning off my taste buds. The pad Thai and chicken dumplings are my go too. Cannot say enough good things about this place.

eIdRzWJSTlQd0MjiD3A0aw.text: Omg. We live Thai food so this was a must! Wow. Everything is hand made, home rolled... fabulous. Like I might move to Bloomfield just to be closer to this gem. And who doesn't love a BYOB?!?

1TSttbEY35F3gdJxLxKJ3w.text: I travel a lot for work and I don't always have the time to go out for food. Sometimes I just need delivery, If you don't deliver you shouldn't advertise that you do.

YjxjRtj3rX8FvsRxrqLqjw.text: I've ordered from Thai Cuisine before and found the food to be pretty decent, but I haven't ordered for a few months. I decided to order the massaman curry today and it was the most disappointing food I've had in a really long time. The veggies were either overcooked or undercooked (potatoes practically hard, while the cabbage was falling apart). The sauce was the real frustration, though. Almost entirely white in color (massaman is typically an orange hue), it tasted like watered down coconut milk. I had ordered it medium spicy (5/10), and there was literally no spice or flavor in the sauce at all. I will never order from Thai Cuisine again.

ywr1nORuQ4ejb8_sanaL7w.text: Best Thai food in town, for sure.  Screw all those other places, they're inferior and probably cost way more.  The green curry is my favorite thing, but the yellow curry is pretty good.  There are vegetarian options (although I usually go for the meat), and one time they had a salmon tom kha gai soup special, which I wasn't sure was a good idea, but it was actually a terrific idea.  One of the few places I can take any or all of my family or in-laws and be sure that everyone will enjoy themself.  The name kind of lends itself to semi-comedic confusion, though: "Where do you want to go for dinner?" "How about Thai Cuisine?" "Thai sounds great.  Where do you want to go?" "Um... Thai Cuisine?" (Wash, rinse, repeat...)

I2XuWNm56inhKCsDz_2hcg.text: One of my favorite Thai places, maybe ever.  Fresh, sweet, spicy and all around good.  Not super heavy or cloying sweet.  Friendly service and all at a fair price.    I hate hearing my neighbors, though.

BPnh9XSkLQPsiM_L4zVe9Q.text: I've had better Thai food, but curry was very tasty (had the Red Bean Curry). Red flag when we were served generic green tea (bag) in diner style mugs?!? & charged $2 for a 6oz mug of hit water?!! Green Tea should be served in a tea pot & cups (not mugs). Prefer the other Thai place 2 blocks away - more authentic!

gl16tQuTATEzONbGbc13FA.text: I've been here twice so far and it is actually very good. I'm extremely judgmental when it comes to thai food and though the food wasn't perfect (but it was satisfying) i'm still going to give it four stars because I have yet to find a better thai place in Pittsburgh that isn't a murderously long drive away from our house.

LeoKnh3DbnGMkQbrOYOHzA.text: Best curries in Pittsburgh and possibly the best curries I've ever had.  Noodle dishes and appetizers are good, but the curries are the main attraction.   Definitely one of my favorite places in Pittsburgh.

ooBLvc1L_-ZzYPN1-GVXgw.text: Always delicious, i think the best dish I've had here is the Thai Eggplant dish with whatever kind of meat or tofu you want.  Their Tom Yum is also amazing.  Have been here several times and I love it

_xfSGLN40bqKVtj-SMvE_g.text: Hands down, the best Thai food I've ever had!  I think their specialty are their curries.  You can't go wrong with any of their curries.    I think their other dishes are good, but not all of them are in the same level as their curries.  Their pad thai was good and their spicy calamari was a bit underwhelming.  For appetizers, I've tried their taro roll (good!) and their thai spring rolls (good as well!).  For soups, I've tried their Tom Yum soup and it was excellent - just not served in a easy-to-ladle-and-serve container.  BUT, with that being said, head straight there and order their curry!  It's excellent!

xSYmUqGgKro7O3hnBXcRHQ.text: Bummer. Closed until the end of January 2012 for renovations.

OKOg1bvpBbnGkQOl55a2Lw.text: I will start my review by saying that I am not a Thai food expert, but I love Thai Cuisine!  My friends have a hard time talking me into trying any other Thai restaurant as I keep coming back here.  I'm hooked!

WVDAZ5kBD2A6e_3fEN8xsw.text: Friendly Service. Fresh Veggies! At only 1 dollar a person for BYOB and no corkage this place is a steal! The price is right too!   If you are a veggie, curry, wine lover who loves family style friendly service, then this place is for you!

59n3vAqRI6a6DdGBUgG0BA.text: Love the front stand lady who does take out,  always pleasant and smiling. Favorite thai food in the burgh! Yummmmmmmm!

c0ls8puZgZN69G0vTtbxMg.text: This is absolutely one of my favorite places to eat!  I have been here almost every week for the past couple months.  The food is delicious.  The service is fantastic & friendly. The atmosphere is very pleasant.  Recommended: The curry.  The green is good, and the yellow is to die for.  They have a pretty big menu, along with a separate vegetarian one.  The prices are very reasonable.  No alcohol here, but it's BYOB (only $1 a glass if you bring a bottle of wine).    I really can't imagine finding better Thai food in Pittsburgh, or anywhere for that matter -- YUM.

MzBlD6Uwqk9YwrzT4T6KCg.text: Hands down a great thai restaurant.   I ordered the Tom Yum Veggie Soup because of all the yelper's great experience, however, I thought the soup had a bit too much lemon juice.  Aside from that, my husband and I enjoyed a great meal.  We ordered the Fresh Tofu Roll, Spicy Beef Basils and Chicken Pad Thai.  It seems that no one talks about this number system of how spicey they should make your food.  The waiter asks if how spicey it should be from 1 to 10 (being the hottest).  We picked a number 4 and the Spicy Beef Basils was still very spicy.  The Pad Thai was delicious and amazing.  All together our bill came out to be $32.  We will definitely go here again very soon!

zhEKMgsiW6IXFXZGFgFRJg.text: Not much to say but I like this place. The Thai style fried rice with crab or lobster meat is pretty good. Service is ok and ambiance is good.

2zDftvHg-GVAVlpthsoeFw.text: Would rather eat here than anywhere else in the world. Green curry. Pad Thai. Yum yum yum yum yum. 5 Yums on the yum scale. And addictive.

pbhlP94d9cixWL84dtFcYA.text: This place is great, we as a family went to the restaurant to celebrate a graduation.  I yelped Thai food and realized this place was close and had great reviews.  I got the curry tofu and it was great, the spring rolls where awesome too.  I also had some of the Pad Thai and the drunken Noodles both as good as the first.

MtLqXOdzWBh_zwVdIiAJSQ.text: Why haven't I revewied Thai Cuisine before?! I was feeling ridiculously lazy tonight so I ordered delivery from them for the millionth time (available through Wheel Deliver, FYI) and I felt like they deserved some recognition since I have never had a negative experience here.  There isn't much to say about Thai Cuisine, really. The name says it all--straight-up, no frills Thai. They aren't trying to do anything creative or fusiony, they just make good food. First things first, I'm obsessed with fresh spring rolls so for a restaurant to become my primary Thai destination, it has to get those right. Thai Cuisine's are not the best I've ever had, but they are definitely up there as one of my favorites in Pittsburgh. Soft, fresh, and big...nothing's worse than a puny spring roll that is practically frozen from sitting in a refrigerator all day (ahem...Thai Place). So since Thai Cuisine passes the spring roll test, I can talk about their other food, which is all delicious. My favorite is the Pineapple Curry, but I've liked everything I've tried here. If you're one of those people who doesn't venture past Pad Thai, don't worry, that's good too. As a bonus, the portions here are pretty large so the prices are pretty reasonable for the amount of food you get.  The most reliable Thai place I've found so far in the city (although I haven't tried them all yet).

6TH3kN2lgYrCzgR0aJuTuQ.text: I always, without fail, order the Green Curry. It is so, so, so good.

QwXehsxsc5-t9cMlkwvrzw.text: I surmised two things from my visit to Thai Cuisine:  a) the competition among thai restaurants must not be very stiff in this town  b) yinzers wouldn't know good thai food if it flew into their open mouths  This place was horrible. My fried trout was just a battered butterflied fish not much different from what you'd find at a church fish-fry. Insipid, over-battered and generally unpleasant. My dining partner's masaman curry was so sickly sweet it tasted like melted coconut ice cream. Surprisingly, the joint was slammed.   On the bright side, service was very fast. On the downside, our waitress was definitely stressed out and cranky possibly from waiting on the 14-top of inebriated co-eds across the room from us.  The takeaway: If you're from Pittsburgh, you'll probably love this place -- it was packed with your kinsmen when I was there. But if you've enjoyed quality thai food in any large coastal metropolis, steer clear.  p.s. food was needlessly pricey given the poor quality.

MGsZAz1UFDQqEGmG1bEE5A.text: This is another one of the great Thai places that Pittsburgh has to offer.  I've been here a few times, and I know I'll keep coming back.  I usually get the Pad Se Ew, and it has a good amount of veggies and chicken.  My favorite here has to be the dessert - Mango Sticky Rice, which very simple, but very tasty (and refreshing in the summer).  I haven't tried the curries, but after reading the other reviews it is next on my list.  The decor is more 'professional' than Spice Island and its generally  quieter, so its easier to chat in a larger group.

ZEPVwOBQTQJ39cjXURmEzA.text: I come here if not weekly, every other week.  My favorite is the Spicy fried rice. I've tried the chicken, shrimp and vegetable.  Personally the Vegetable is my favorite. I always get my food with a spice level between 3-4.  3 has a nice kick to it, where you can still enjoy your food. I made the mistake once getting a 7 and couldn't really enjoy it because my nose was running.  If you're one that likes that kind of spice I suggest getting a 7.    The chicken Green Curry is also another go to item. Filled with plenty of vegetables, nice size pieces of chicken and the sauce is very good.    The owner is the friendliest person I've ever met. Always pleasant. Overall my FAVORITE Thai spot in Pittsburgh.

ETDgi2vrlr9ZQOVvtHWsqw.text: Great food and service. The crispy duck is delicious and tasty. Pad Thai is good as well. We ordered a fried banana thing (forget the official name)as dessert - I upload a pic of it.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Cuisine - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Some fried Banana dessert

Z2WANk18pN1BdR3Qwnhqxg.text: Really excellent food with unparalleled service and atmosphere. The employees here are so friendly and welcoming, I've never experienced such good service at similar restaurants. The restaurant is also really clean and has nice furniture and lighting, making for a relaxing atmosphere.   The panang curry with tofu was really flavorful and the veggies were fresh and well cooked, not mushy. The tofu also had a tangy, fresh flavor and was not bland. I ordered spice level 7 - they deliver spice on a 1-10 scale. It had a good amount of heat, but I like curry HOT so I'd probably go to a 9 next time. You can also ask for a dish of spices, if you prefer to customize the spice level yourself.   This place is also BYOB so it would be perfect for a casual date or celebration. I can't wait to come back!

nofCSwxqAvV0ds1_pWXozQ.text: I have difficulty with finding a good Thai restaurant in Pittsburgh. Like my previous visit to this restaurant, I again ordered the green curry, this time with just vegetables. This time, the curry was very watery and almost tasteless. I will give them credit for having a very good pork bun.

kL3VfUc-CTPkhWwiTXT4Qg.text: It's fine Thai food. Nothing extraordinary, but sold Americanized Thai food and it gets the job done.

zgvKXTk86Ge-gXOTuI6f7Q.text: Thai Cuisine is authentic, delicious Thai food! Honestly, I've had all their competitors and have yet to find a better pork bun and green curry. I usually order take out, and they are always friendly and quick to prepare my order. Anytime I have dined in, the service has been great.   I recommend this restaurant as the best Thai in Pittsburgh. They offer spice levels from 1-10 and always go the extra mile.

0QGUE53FqU8yc5sg0CYNUA.text: Wow I love this place! Just visited Thailand recently and honestly this is right up there with the most authentic Thai restaurants in Bangkok! Ordered the green curry chicken (spice level 8), the chicken satae with peanut sauce, and chicken gyoza. Enough food for 3 people for only $30.   I would highly recommend the green curry. It's packed full of amazingly fresh veggies and the protein of your choice. Can't wait till I'm back in the burgh to order again.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Cuisine - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Green Curry Chicken, chicken gyoza and chicken satae delivered by grubhub.

uE4qRE-w8WAyb9iUkHvuYQ.text: I've tried to give them a couple tries but its consistently bad. I cant speak for the curry but the noodle dishes and appetizers I've had are bad.  Tonight we ordered pad thai, pad see ew and the fresh thai cuisine rolls...  The noodles were mostly tasteless and greasy. The spring rolls were filled with ice berg lettuce and they literally sliced the shrimp in half that they put inside.  35 dollars for 2 tastless noodle dishes and an app of iceberg lettuce is a bit much.   Go to Thai Gourmet or Noodlehead. Bigger portions, cheaper, and way better tasting.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Cuisine - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Half shrimps and lettuce
Photo of Thai Cuisine - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pad Thai
Photo of Thai Cuisine - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lettuce roll....

yzseHCZM-2AhTP2xVak1qQ.text: I've been here a few times and it's never disappointed. I really liked their lychee curry - they only have this on special, it is not on their main menu. All of their other curries are amazing too along with their pad Thai. It's definitely a hidden gem.

29MERsFNzb1IpxdnAV6cgg.text: I've been wanting to try both Thai Cuisine and Thai Gourmet since they're within a few blocks of one another. My verdict is that I prefer Thai Gourmet, food-wise anyway. However, there's no doubt that the overall atmosphere is much better at Thai Cuisine. Thai Cuisine feels cleaner and better decorated.   In terms of the food, I ordered curry and it was okay. I thought it was very mild in comparison to Thai Gourmet. My husband ordered Hawaiian fried rice and also thought it was ok. It smelled smoky but lacked the taste to match it. One thing I really did enjoy was the fried chicken dumplings, but the downfall is you only get four (and they're tiny!).   Thai Cuisine was about average to me. I would consider coming back to try it again.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Cuisine - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried Chicken Dumplings
Photo of Thai Cuisine - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Winter Curry
Photo of Thai Cuisine - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hawaiian Fried Rice

t9tUeoQs8dnCDP2UliqSHw.text: Thai Cuisine has got to be  one of the best Thai restaurants I've ever been to. Definitely comparable to the quality you'd expect at restaurants in major cities like NYC or Chicago. The fried Thai spring rolls are so super good and in my top five for appetizers. Stuffed with veggies and glass noodles. Pad Thai with chicken or beef are amongst my regular orders. But I also love the Thai steak and spicy noodles with beef (level 8). And the green tea cheesecake, holy heck you guys...amazeballs!!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Cuisine - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spicy noodles with beef.
Photo of Thai Cuisine - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried Thai spring rolls.
Photo of Thai Cuisine - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried Thai spring rolls.

KEX9oqYgHOuQCgk22K2mwQ.text: Loved this place so much that I ended up working there while during University. The owners are incredibly friendly and the food is to die for. I've never had a bad meal here and I've tried pretty much everything on the menu. Definitely one of my favorite Thai restaurants in Pittsburgh, and that is saying a lot!

B-0B9n13EsYZe4rMyaRHpQ.text: Secret off menu item that I just discovered!!! ORDER THE CHAING MAI NOODLES!!! I feel like I need to shout this from the rooftops! If it's not a special, you can still order it.   Pittsburgh has more than a few asian noodle fusion and Thai noodle spots but NOTHING compares to the Chaing Mai at Thai Cuisine in Bloomfield.   Everything at Thai cuisine is awesome but these noodles just blew me away. Juicy chicken, perfectly crisp blanched veggies and noodles all topped in a fabulous coconut curry sauce. Finished with a few crispy fried thin noodle crispies that add a little crunch!

ZVfQXNYj5fxO8PX4LuxzUg.text: Probably the best Thai is town. Love this place and very friendly staff as well.  I would recommended any of the Curry dishes or the orange chicken. A++

loZbA1oSR5Luh4fIEWnr7w.text: Extremely rude manager who curses you and drops a call on you when you try to address the issue with your order. No apologies for messed up order, no respect. Spoilt evening and destroyed mood. Disgusting place. No such place should run if they have so much disrespect to their customers and unable to fix their mistakes.

rgY7CYQlxD1sUwklQJiazg.text: Good place for Thai food! Tasted authentic and the spring rolls were so crispy :)

eF0VOIJgjWIHCzbw0yqHCw.text: This is my second time getting food from this place. The first time we ordered pad Thai and it was nothing amazing.  Tonight I ordered green curry which is my favorite, as well as chicken satay with extra peanut sauce.  Both the peanut sauce and curry were super watery. This is so disappointing. I wanted to love this place as it's so close to our house, but damn. Are they just trying to save a buck? Is this normal for them? I didn't order curry essence, I ordered curry! Boo.  Time to try another place, I guess

eLsfWrNIeHes138FAOjXaQ.text: I think this is liking the most underrated Thai in the city. I've always had a really solid experience with whatever I've ordered off of the menu, vegan or otherwise. The service is always pleasant and never feels like you're being rushed along.

11Ua0CQ960JpyXUYcBIQXA.text: Loved the Viking Noodles. Great Service..food was very prompt and Spring rolls were hot. Spring Rolls were good but could have used some "different " ingredients. Definitely on the return list to Bloomfield

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Cuisine - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

kM-GH3hC6YHt9HuYxAF_Tg.text: My favorite Thai place in the city!  The food is delicious, regardless of ordering it for take out or dining in, and everyone who works there is friendly.

sy3i7beHc9RhvdPhOr3p-g.text: I didn't quite realize how much I love Thai Cuisine until they closed for a few months to remodel. Their absence was deeply felt. Now that they are back in action, the restaurant is better than ever! It is now fully handicapped accessible, with a bright clean new dining room and multiple bathroom stalls. I was worried that the prices may increase due to the remodel, but no, they are the same. The food, also same, if not improved. The Tom Kha soup is as awesome as can be and our entrees were perfectly delicious. They still feature a separate vegetarian menu to make ordering easy. Most anything on the vegetarian menu is or can be vegan (just ask about egg - veg items do not contain fish sauce or shrimp paste). And the service has always been excellent.

RHQdYSVvQrges0P3YpsFZg.text: Have been going here for probably 10 years, and have never been disappointed.  Top notch food, great service, and the specials are always worth trying out.  My favorite Thai in Pittsburgh.

2J2vHUj-i92LkeFyqpqjgw.text: blandest thai food in pittsburgh I think.  You could really just walk down a few blocks and spend less for better food.  I think the only people that like the food are vegatarians since they have fake meats.  Their sauces literally are all the same, their curries are bad, and everything is way more expensive than it should be.  Their new facade is ugly as can be too.  It looks like someone used some old floor tile from a kitchen and used it as brick for the front of the building.  Looked way better before. D-

4aAXq1tsaD09y0fxkHnE3w.text: Came here for lunch on a weekday with the bf and during our meal, I noticed it started to get really crowded, which meant this place is a go to spot for Thai food. The lunch prices here are very affordable and the service was friendly. The fried wonton pieces they gave us before our meal was sort of stale though. Anyway, I got the pad see ew and it was okay, borderline pretty good. It wasn't as flavorful as I hoped it would be compared to the other Thai restaurants I've been to, but again, it was still good, just not memorable. You also get a good amount of food too for the lunch specials. We ended our meal with the mango & sweet rice dessert and it was tasty. The rice was cooked perfectly and the mango was ripe and sweet. Overall the food was good (A-ok), but I sort of feel like I've had more flavorful Thai food at other restaurants. But I can see why people come here for a quick and affordable lunch especially if you are craving Thai food.

NH6msDQGOrylopNi4GyYQw.text: When I lived in Pittsburgh, I was always trying to find the best Thai restaurant. I failed miserably. So when I visited for July 4th, I had a friend take me to her favorite place. This was it! and I was grateful!  I went with about 8 people and we BYOB'ed which was a fantastic idea. Some semi-sweet white wine went well with the flavorful light Thai food. Most of the table had the curries(I thought the red was the best), but I went with the eggplant with the vegetarian duck. Simply delicious! Highly highly recommend it. The spicy basil sauce was the highlight. My partner had one of the chef specials, which was by far the most interesting, but maybe not the tastiest.   Overall, an affordable, low-fuss, great place to eat. There also seemed to be a steady crowd there when we got there and left. It looks like a popular spot. For good reason!

pF05_dWZQWxaEwSKJUmXlA.text: We landed here thanks to Yelp reviews. Great little place is like a hidden gem. Food was great and service was just fantastic. We plan to return soon. Portions are large and price is reasonable. We tried both appetizers and main dishes which turned out to be delicious. We tried chicken dumplings, satay, Hawaiian fried rice and hot pot. Everything turned out good. There Is ample paid street parking. So next time, we desire for Thai food, we know where to go.

1viaW5A1dZjWMVjbI53Iig.text: Thai Cuisine was very good and might be deserving of 5 stars but I have only been there once and there were a couple of items that knocked it down to 4.  I started with Tom Yum Veggie, it was loaded wit LOTS of fresh vegetables, the broth had a little too much lime in it for me and the idea of adding extra heat with chili flakes was okay but overall the broth lacked any sort of flavor outside of base, lime, chili flakes.   I had the Spciy Basill Noodles, this dish was excellent very similar to Pad Kee Mao but it had egg and bell pepper in it. This dish alone deserved 5 stars.  My only other critique is that I had ginger tea and it was westernized version, on the sweet side and lacking the spiciness of True ginger tea.  With my little nit-picks aside I currently highly recommend this dining establishment, not that they need much help, they were very busy as they should be - go enjoy.

ofaQow-OoTDJT9OYoNL1Rw.text: Stopped here based on its Yelp raiting while driving through Pittsburgh. The other Yelpers are right--this is a good place. The food was excellent, the service was prompt, and the prices were very reasonable.  My one complaint is that my wife ordered a tea that never came. Mistakes happen, so I'm not going to take a star off for this, but if you go here don't be afraid to remind the waitstaff if they forget part of your order.

1q31K4A_8pFkUXiaZ_I3OQ.text: Thai Cuisine is one of the best Thai places I've been to in the States - finding it in Pittsburgh was a real surprise.  The food here is outstanding, and the service is comparable to what I'd expect in a $50/person restaurant, and this place is definitely not $30/plate.  With appetizers, Thai iced tea, and two entrees, my girlfriend and I paid about $30.  I highly recommend the cold chicken and sprout salad.  Wish I could remember the name of it, because it's heavenly.  (...Which probably assumes that heaven looks like Thailand.  ...Which would be a nice place to spend eternity.)  Thai iced tea is really good, too.

Sm4jVh_8d7gWhucr_ltDKg.text: Of the many, many good things that come with living in Bloomfield, Thai Cuisine tops the list. I've only ordered take out, but the service has always been above par. The place is BYOB, which means you can have a fancy meal on the cheap. They have a great veg menu, it's not over saturated with fake meat, or light on the protein. Their menu strikes a great vegetable/protein balance for non-meat eaters, and it looks like it does the same for omnivores.  The price is great too, you can get plenty of food for about $10 per person (not including tip or drinks)

ChhXX5rbI8G7FXG726rDOA.text: Food was not bad (I ordered the green curry chicken), but their poor choice of plates and cups (tea cups were like diner coffee mugs) didn't feel very authentic. I would order for take out instead next time.

peeI4a_ItrNr0lz2XeKxXQ.text: Went here last week and it was good. Nothing special, but good.  If you're looking for a reasonable and inexpensive thai meal, head here.   If I could, I'd give it a 3.5.

Embsbo3Nu9gvj6bK8wr2-w.text: Delicious-- try the spicy basil noodles.  Really relaxed atmosphere, nice low lighting, friendly staff.  Your water glass will never get more than a third empty!    Oh, sometimes I really miss Pittsburgh.

yogv_0txMMHs-nKAxtFAbQ.text: What a gem of a place, situated as it is amongst the Italian eateries in Bloomfield, Pittsburgh's Little Italy. This is my favorite Thai restaurant in the city, and arguably the best. I've not had a bad meal here, and everything I've tried has been delicious, with the green curry standing out in my mind as one of the best I've had anywhere. We came here with a large group of people one night, some of whom had never had Thai food, and all left happy and appreciative of my excellent taste when it comes to choosing restaurants. (pat, pat, pat). One of my friends had the springroll and liked it so much he ordered another for dinner. Service here is always good, with a friendly and professional staff that takes the time to help you with ordering. The one downside is that parking is a challenge, as this is a busy street in a bustling neighborhood. I usually find parking on a sidestreet, and would brave much more difficult hurdles to get to this food.

414EKLrisbDmiytWtHlUBA.text: I must write a review for this restaurant!  :)  I have lived in Pittsburgh for almost 8 years now and luckily found this Thai restaurant early in my move.  Let me start with a little story.  My sister lived in Northern California and was visiting.  We were talking about places to eat and I of course mentioned and suggested Thai Cuisine, knowing how good their food is.  My sister was skeptical, to say the least, mentioning in the same breath that she lives in the San Francisco area, could a place in Pittsburgh actually be that good if not better than restaurants in CA?  I decided to let the food speak for itself  --- and it did!  My sister ordered the red curry (duck with pineapple), her fave dish, and she LOVED it.  In fact, she admitted after that this restaurant was indeed the best she had had - and that it was too bad that it was in Pittsburgh.    Me personally?  I love the green curry with mock duck (wheat gluten) - and I am not vegan or vegetarian.  I would like to mention that this restaurant has a nice selection of vegetarian and vegan options.  The crispy spring rolls are yummy, especially with the sauce.  The soups are all pretty great.    You should try this restaurant, it will definitely be worth your time.  And if you like your food spicy, like I do, make sure you tell them you want it thai spicey at 10 out of 10!  :)

Ns3VGRVbuIV_9JmzD5ZIgA.text: What's not to love about Thai Cuisine?  Relaxed and spacious atmosphere.  Friendly hosts who will humor you if you try to speak Thai to them, and of course great Thai food.   They were even kind enough to offer me a generous handful of Kaffir lime leaves when I wanted to try my own hand at some Thai cookin!

_XtkaTKlU9KU6SkFS89J1w.text: I love this restaurant! I do think it's the best Thai place in town. The curry is amazing and i love the appetizers. Anything I've ever gotten here is great. The service is also very good and the staff is always friendly.

RolPizKXRNIkKfC0vFfCTQ.text: Like other reviewers have said, this place is very basic but the service is fast and friendly and the food was amazing. The vegetarian Tom Yum soup was perfect! We ordered the special of the day - a fried trout dish which was incredible. The price was very reasonable too. The six year old in our party (who doesn't like spicy food) loved the fried dumpling which was recommended by our server and one of the house specialties - three flavored chicken. We ordered the banana springroll for desert - also tasty. Don't expect a fancy place but if you want really good and fast thai food, this is the place to go in Pittsburgh.

Ninpd12OrsrT326Zf8kFEw.text: As an expatriate of Pgh, Thai Cuisine was an unexpected gem in the middle of the city.  I have found very little in my current venue of Boston which compares well.  The prices are extremely reasonable, and the seating is intimate. The cuisine is extremely authentic (especially for being Pittsburgh) and is suited from picky eaters to foodies.

Y6wN7iDG-lDqgha39IjIWA.text: I heart Thai Cuisine! Ryan B. and I always go there for our Thai fix! We ordered the Tom Yum shrimp soup, which was so flavorful and hearty, as well as the Won Ton soup, which was a million times more flavorful than what you'd find in the typical Chinese restaurant.   Our entrees are typically Winter Curry, which Ryan B. LOVES, and Cashew Chicken, which is spicy and delicious.   Be sure to BYOB, this place is a must!

bO0xR5dByuhhiVvrDndWaw.text: Excellent.  My wife and I had a great meal there last night.  Friendly staff and great food.  In fact the Pad Thai was so good, we ordered some to go.

hGoYikdVnNm9T9opMRycPA.text: love this place. Take out or dine in - always good. Like that it's BYOB.

-uxJob91x_Ra4OZv2CWHcQ.text: Ordered for the first time after great reviews. Got pretty sick from the Hawaiian fried rice. So much so I should have gone to the er. Clearly, it was food poisoning. Had all of the symptoms,  it did pass after 24hrs, Contacted them, just to alert them to check their food, however still have not received a return phone call.

sYG6YBwr7JnvyGt_Yp4hog.text: It is okay for the food, but really not what I expected. The green curry is actually yellow curry, oh well.

6-VEb6aq1gvpXnq3q_uc6w.text: My favorite go to for thai comfort food! The staff is always friendly, the food is always hot and prepared exactly the way I ask for it. I'm a lover of very hot food and the spicey basils never dissapoint me. The curry is wonderful and the desserts are perfect. Top off with jasmine tea and add a talkative friend to create the perfect lunch or dinner!

cHIsY62i9JiGGcSj6-_jzQ.text: Thai Cuisine is the BEST Thai in town!  Hands down.  I've visited most of the other thai places in town (Nicky's Thai Kitchen, Bangcock Balcony, Thai Gourmet, Thai Me Up, Thai Place (fox chapel and shadyside) and they are all inferior to thai cuisine in bloomfield.  Thai cuisine's curries are always sublime.  As my husband said, their curries are like "a party in my mouth".  The flavors are sublimely mixed, like perfect artistry.   Since it open over 10 years ago, I have been a fan.  I know them on a first name basis as I've been going there for their curry for so long.  Their noodle dishes are good, but the curry is where they surpass everyone in town.    PS I still have to try "the Smiling Banana Leaf", but I'm always so disappointed by the amount of fish sauce in all of the other curries in town that I can't take trying out new thai places in town anymore.  None of them compare.   I am the poster child for this place and I tell everyone who comes to Pittsburgh, who will listen, that they must get there asap.

7ZiMEng0Nywprg173Cc-Mg.text: Two friends of mine raved about this place & we decided to go on my recent visit to Pittsburgh (I'm originally from here, now living in Chicago). It was everything they said it would be! The owner, Lisa, couldn't have been any nicer! So sweet!  I started off with the Fresh (not fried) Thai Cuisine roll. Not the best I've ever had, but very good (good enough that I WOULD re-order them).   I then moved on to the Spicy Basil Chicken. I ordered brown rice and for the month of February, it comes in the shape of a heart! Whimsy! This dish was very yummy! Freshly prepared, the veggies were cooked just right (tender crunchiness), the chicken was moist and the spice level (I chose 5) was just right. I would order this dish again as well.  In summary, reasonably priced, VERY friendly service (our waiter was charming), great food and a nice atmosphere. I would definitely seek this restaurant out on my next visit.

CABBCJqL3QudSsaQ5o8Dnw.text: This is our favorite go-to place. I have not been disappointed by anything I have tried here. Love all of the curries. The pad Thai is the best I have tried anywhere, even outside of Pittsburgh. The Hawaiian fried rice is amazing!

RlhDekvbH-dEhpvurUpXFQ.text: This place exceeded all expectation. Great customer service and outstanding quality food. Will go back whenever in town. My son goes to Pitt and took a friend there already. Highly recommend!

OMFGL9cdKvtBsN_20VXXNQ.text: Best thai cuisine in Pgh.  Thank god it's practically in my backyard!  Love the curries, egg rolls, pork buns and sticky rice!

LrhYchKjYPZM6VRz1yKtJw.text: I asked around Yelp to see what the best Pad Thai in the city was and a lot of people said Thai Cuisine. To my surprise I ended up moving a block away from the place. I go here once or twice a week to get the Pad Thai. Yeah, I could live off Thai food. The pad tha0i is delicious! So is the fried goyza. Try it! Seriously. The portions are so large that the pad thai lasts me a couple meals.

39JLHE6TmDfk_8FUqP5h9Q.text: Me and my friend had a "Bangkok Seafood" and a "Thai Treasure Hot Pot". Both of them were very delicious, except the yellow curry in the seafood didn't seem quite well dissolved. To be fair, it happens a lot for Thai/Indian food, which therefore didn't bother us enjoy our great dinner.

-5e23-t6_FG1Jzz3PHtYqQ.text: Oh my, Thai Cuisine, how I miss living a few blocks from you.   This is my favorite Thai restaurant in Pittsburgh.  I couldn't even begin to count the number of times that I have been to this place. I mean it when I say everything is delicious.  I have had multiple curries, noodles, and apps, and none have disappointed. A few of my favorites, Chicken Dumplings (steamed or fried), Thai Spring Rolls, Pad Thai (naturally), Thai Cuisine Bird Nest, and Spicy Basil Noodles.   Service here is always on point, even when they're busy.  This place is BYOB, so bring your favorite adult bevie and enjoy. While a smaller restaurant, they happily can accommodate larger parties.  While they don't deliver, you can get take out, so you can bring home a yummy Thai treat.  I need to go here again asap!!! :)

6lQtjxGuCBhgMj3tY3Y_3A.text: Great service and fantastic food. We were short on time coming in and I was fresh off a rough day of work and en route to a breastfeeding class with my wife.    After a failed first entry in an Italian joint that wasn't going to cut it in 45 minutes or allow me to be awake after, we stopped here.   My wife and I both got curry, her a 2, me a 7 and it was great, I would recommend if you are in the area. I really needed a beer that day and they do not have any..and sit across from several places with great happy hours and microbrews...aw well, if you want good Thai Food in Bloomfield this is your place

5BNfoNoB7-G7LnXBX2v2tw.text: Great food.  Great service.  We dine here at least twice a month and love it. The Pad Thai and bamboo shoot curry are both amazing! I love that they have a spicy scale and you can choose your spice level on any dish.

X30GRJ70cuJL2BUA0vUFsA.text: This is by far the best Thai food in Pittsburgh! My husband introduced me to Thai food a few years ago and ever since then I've been addicted to pad thai. :) Specifically, Thai Cuisine's version. We don't live near the restaurant, but somehow that doesn't stop us from getting take out once a week.  The staff is very knowledgable and super friendly. It is also byob, which is always a nice bonus.

mu9fAmyRUkktvDfJjklJEg.text: Pretty good and decently priced for a Thai place. I was sick when I went there (the ginger tea helped me quite a bit). The wait staff was very friendly and came over to ask if we needed anything on a regular basis even though it was close to 10pm.  Spicy noodles were great. We also ordered the lychee curry, which I thought was ok, but nothing too spectacular. All in all a good place for decent thai food in pittsburgh.

rVur3wYSWlNVFDyFx4DW9g.text: A year later, prices have increased 70% and the quality of food have declined. Customer service is still superb though. Today, I ordered a pad-see-yew with beef level 5 - was made in an old pan with burnt scraps, 25% beef in dish only, there were clumps of chili not blended in the dish, and was drenched in oil. Another dish, red curry with chicken, was always lacking chicken pieces, they've increased prices and cut back on portions and quality, which happens quite often to good restaurants gone bad. Sad to say, this used to be my favorite place, but now we will never return and we are currently looking for another Thai place to be our go-to.

3SyZAcn9HDjYWrf8ON9ZAA.text: I agree 100% on Maggie G's review. Over priced, bad food, and Pittsburgh DOESN'T know GOOD Thai food.. Plus $40 bucks on Take out...seriously? Ill pass I've had better Thai for less.   Yellow Curry (Ive added a picture of exactly how watery the curry truly is )  (x2) Spring Rolls (2 per order) Dumplings (5 per order)  Wontons (4/5 per order) _____________  40 BUCKS  Ill stick to Bangkok Balcony. No more trying out different Thai places in the city. I rather not waste my money on watered down curries and bland dishes which seems to be the norm for the Pittsburgh Thai scene.

W-n0Lx8ltQVPetCUiuAnQg.text: Absolutely BEST Thai in PGH. After moving to Pittsburgh from LA at the beginning of 2015 my fiance and I hunted for a Thai place that could compare w/ our favorite place that we left behind. This spot is by far the best tasting, best service in the city. we go often and have never had a meal we didn't enjoy.

EswGeDIvsTBRYhtYdx8yxg.text: Thai Cuisine is my go-to restaurant here in Pittsburgh. I didn't discover it until I had lived in Pittsburgh for almost a year, but since then, my friends and I have been going almost weekly--I think it's becoming an addiction.  They have a good number of tables and a couple of booths, so seating has never been an issue, even when we're with a larger group. The staff are friendly and incredibly attentive; I don't think I've ever had a glass of water that was less than three-quarters full. The food arrives at your table less than 10 minutes after the waiter takes your order. Their spice levels are pretty on point and range from 1-10, but you can always ask for the spice rack if you need an extra kick. I've tried almost all their noodle dishes and a handful of the curries and nothing has disappointed. They make one of the best Pad Thais I've ever eaten. They also have specials that are ever rotating, which makes it nice if you're looking to try something new. In general, everything is flavorful and you get what you order. Portions are sufficient for a solid meal and very reasonably priced.  I might venture and say that this is one of the best Thai places in Pittsburgh, but I know that's highly debated here. I'll just say that it's one of the most reliable Thai places I've ever gone to and I'm happy to frequent it regularly.

7kTqh0r7LeLvUJqaHLVzFw.text: I went here for lunch while at West Penn Hospital with a co-worker on a recommendation from someone else. I could not decide what I wanted so I went with a safe bet with Pad Thai with a 6 on the spice scale. I was a fan. It could've used a little more spice. I may try for an 8 on spice scale next time I go. Portions are very big and the price for the entire meal was very reasonable.   Go get your noms on. :D

Al0WjEdOz350j6zb0xlgoA.text: With the not-so-recent closing of Sweet Basil still looming in my mind, I have yet to find a new thai food home.  I headed to Thai Cuisine with high hopes and several positive reviews from friends.  The service was good, decor so-so, and prices were great.  In fact, I double-checked the bill because I thought the waitress may have forgotten to add an entree, it was that reasonably priced!    The food was good, solid thai food.  My mind wasn't blown, nor was I disappointed.  I think all thai restaurants need to unite and decide on a single "heat scale" to rule them all.  Some places it's 1-5, some 1-10, and I've even seen a 1-7 thrown in here and there.  The problem is, they are all subjective to the cook.  I ordered a 7 out of 10 and got back something milder than mild buffalo wing hot.  I think I ruined the food a little by adding my own mix of chilis.  My wife loved her curry, and my pad thai wasn't bad.  I'd go back, but the search continues...

TMsCLEy5qwNqNyNN64r_pA.text: Would rate the food a B/B-, value is a B as well. Flavors are either bland or too sweet... However, I DID have the soup on several occasions and would rate it a solid B+. Ambiance is a B+ as well. Staff is always nice and it's easy to get a table. However, wouldn't say this is very authentic Thai food.

ESHcUquidhUzqOO6SAoZ0w.text: If you live in Pittsburgh, you may understand how contentious the issue of "favorite local Thai restaurants" is.  So, I'll begin this review w/ my personal bias: Thai Cuisine is our go-to Thai restaurant in Pittsburgh. This is in part due to proximity, but the relationship is on no small part sustained through friendly staff and consistent dining experiences.  Thai Cuisine is -- as my wife and I like to put it -- a rainy-Sunday-evening type place. Their curry broths are great, the apps are tasty, but not too filling, and the ambiance -- particularly after their recent renovations -- is warm and inviting.  I'll admit, that if your'e in it purely from a culinary angle, there may be better options, but for the buck, you won't find many that beat Thai Cuisine.

xFgxZSZM889gGInLmRJzjA.text: This is my favorite Thai restaurant in Pittsburgh.  Our waitress was excellent.  The food is really good.    The glass noodle salad has so many fresh flavors going on, it felt like summer - quite welcome in the middle of a cold winter spell.  Their dumplings are nice and big while the dough is still light and thin.  They have a separate vegetarian menu.  Though I am not a vegetarian, I'm sure it is a nice touch for those who are.  Their daily specials are a nice change from the standard Thai fare at so many restaurants.  They are great about tailoring spice levels.    I have a family member who is Thai and prefers the Thai restaurant down the street, however, I'm sticking with Thai Cuisine as my favorite.

MdnSbsmEXD0vGD3wvl96Og.text: This restaurant is as close to the Thai food I experienced whilst traveling through Thailand.  The flavors are fabulous, the atmosphere and decor lovely.  Lisa, her family and staff do a wonderful job! I recommend the Panang curry, larb salad, fresh spring rolls and sticky black pudding, to name only a few!

7a1B6aaWNq6Lki42sza-fw.text: My mom and I walked in and ordered yellow curry chicken, edamame, spring rolls, and mango sticky rice to go. The hostess was very nice and our order was ready quickly. Everything we ordrred was absolutely delicious. We will definitely return next time we are in Pittsburgh!

p_aqTq_bNPpXl7cJps-Xyg.text: Food isn't bad. The server was  unfriendly and uninterested.  We asked for Chilli sauce at the beginning of the meal.  He didn't bring it. We reminded him later after the food was brought. He took his own time.  As for the food, it's nothing special.  There are many Thai restaurants in pittsburgh that do better, and with friendlier staff.

ybXhI1PrIHzGBXvDo0xeTw.text: We stopped back in here on a hot Friday night for our second visit to the place, and it was just as amazing as the first, several years ago.  I like the fact that the name of this restaurant is just what they offer: Thai Cuisine.  Nothing fancy, nothing they can charge you an arm and a leg for because it's gourmet or anything like that.  It's just good, delicious, well-prepared Thai food, served by a knowledgable and friendly waitstaff.  Last night, we were starving after walking around in the 90+ degree heat for several hours, so we ordered a few plates of appetizers to split before our entrees.  They have a page of 'daily specials' with their menu, and 'shrimp blankets' were on it, so we checked them out.  Basically, it's a shrimp (tail-on) in a spring roll, served with a dipping sauce.  So very good.  We also got an order of the spring rolls, which were ever-so-slightly tangy, and the Thai toast, which was so crispy and delicious, I considered getting a second order.  Their cucumber dipping sauce comes with little chunks of fresh cucumber in it.    And since I recently discovered the magic of veggie tom-yum soup, I decided to try theirs.  Oh, so good!  On a hot day, I always crave something salty, and this was exactly what I wanted: the bowl is crammed with veggies and tofu (salty, spicy tofu - yum!), and the broth is just spicy enough to please your tastebuds but not overwhelm them.  The servers will ask how spicy you would like to have your meal prepared (the soup as well).  I tried everything at a 4, which I felt was just fine.  It wasn't bland, but I wasn't panting.  Our server said that around a 7 is when things start to get seriously spicy, so go ahead and order in that range if you are brave!  I had the garlic pepper pork (my favorite Thai meal) for an entree.  It was incredible, salty and garlicky and the white rice was puffy and just the tiniest bit sticky in that perfectly-prepared way.  Lots of good chunks of veggies on the plate as well, and enough sauce to spread on your rice (and enough food to have leftovers for lunch the next day!).  My husband got the pork fried rice, and it was a huge, tasty portion.  Thankfully, the servers were quick with water refills, because all that saltiness makes you thirsty!  Another perk - Thai Cuisine is BYOB!  I truly wish we'd planned on our visit last night, so we could have brought a bottle of wine with us (the closest liquor store is down on Butler Street, so a bit of a hike if you're walking), but we just happened to be in the area when my Thai food craving hit.  I am so glad Thai Cuisine was there to supply the delicious food that I needed!

iGpMnr5lPrPVUNr0F7LCXg.text: Thai Cuisine changed us. My dining companion and I like to explore a menu, trying a bunch of different things. Yet, we both repeated our original orders (Pumpkin Green Curry for me and Spicy Noodles for him) on the second trip. We always share our meals so we get to try two instead of one. Yet, neither of us let the other have a single bite, or even asked for one.   With a fun waitstaff, no reservations needed, under $20 per person meals, BYO, and, consistently good food, we will return. Maybe next time we will explore and share... But I wouldn't count on it...

lzJhFE6LhEty14uoKjptGA.text: If you get nothing else here, get the tom kha soup. It is seriously the best I've ever had anywhere. I'm not trying to be hyperbolic. But this tom kha soup is the standard for which I compare all other tom kha soups. I've yet to find its match. It is truly delicious. I usually get the veggie variation (loaded up with silky smooth tofu and tons of veggies!) but any variation is just as wonderful.   I just returned home from a trip to Thai Cuisine with some friends. The environment is comforting and warm. I love the lights strewn along the windows! They just add to the coziness of the place. After getting the obligatory veggie tom kha soup, I got the green curry with shrimp. Others in my party got the yellow curry and the panang curry and everyone was pleased with their choices. The green curry was a perfect balance of sweet and spicy and the veggies were nice and crisp.  They were featuring their mango and sticky rice dessert. I had a bite of my friend's and I was sad that I was too full to have a dessert of my own!   As we rolled out of our booth, totally stuffed and satisfied, we all proclaimed that this was the best decision we could have made with our night. Definitely one of the best Thai restaurants in the city!

-IrLcjf3cvrKL6Tqy6_SRQ.text: Good food every time. We get a lot of take-out from here and occasionally dine-in.   All noodle dishes are great. Tofu saute appetizer is a favorite of ours. Soup is yummy too!

U_ZXcdhTgJVG0nlulx8gEQ.text: One of my favorite Thai places in the city.  There isn't one complaint I have about this little place.  The hostess greeted us and gave us a choice of tables.  The waiter introduced himself and gave his recommendations on the menu.  We ordered an appetizer, meal, and dessert.  He did not rush our meal, which was fabulous.  Dessert....we had the mango with sticky rice...delicious.  This was a new item that I tried and I was pleasantly surprised.  There isn't much that will keep me away from this wonderful place.

dDKbnAlEKAMcFpIRIk-FSw.text: Good food -- meaning they know how to cook delicious and flavorful food. Most important thing.

jyFqSyg-yX7TfBJmBVnHzA.text: Very good food ! Excellent customer service. Ordered the chicken pad thai and the chicken spicy noodle. Overall, highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Cuisine - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken pad Thai

yLBQeOUF9xtUQ-8WM7iDEA.text: SO delicious and such a beautiful restaurant. And BYOB! Loved the pulled pork buns and the spicy noodle. Yum yum

Fv2ptE0jtI-lULWHt3p75w.text: Stopped in for lunch on a Wednesday afternoon. I got the pulled pork buns which were wonderful. The dough is soft and savory, and the slice of cucumber cuts through the other flavors for a refreshing break. I got the red curry for an entree, as well. The salad was crisp, and the peanut dressing had just the right amount of kick. The curry itself was absolutely delicious. Just the right amount of coconut, and the basil mixed with the pineapple really worked well to balance out the spicyness.

NMMm757g_qnK-kI0xQFWDw.text: We ordered honey duck, yellow curry, and three flavor chicken, tom yum shrimp. The price on the menu looked fine. However, when the food came, I was disappointed with the portion.  And also, you can choose brown rice instead of white rice. But remember brown rice will cost 1 dollar extra. The server did not tell us before we made that selection.  The size of the restaurant is not spacious. So it's not really a good place for a big group to go.  Overall, the food taste fine. But it's won't be my to go place next time.

5ZDzBq0ZthqT06w0F2hu9A.text: This thai place was....ok.  I got the mango curry dish. I mean, it was okay? Wasn't anything special though.... he got the basil fried rice...and he sure enjoyed it...  I think I've definitely tried better thai food though. It's your typical restaurant- but..... I wish there was some kick to it, or some.... more originality? It was just okay.....  Service was superb though. The waiter was constantly around to fill out water glasses. A+ for the service, for sure!
